info.sourceTextContent: Y ansí, sus buenos dos amigos, rogándole [rogáronle] que por ninguna via entrase á solas en el aposento con su padre, porque no le matasen en alguna traicion; y lo mismo encargaron á Apu Mayta, que quedaba con él, que mirase por su señor; y ansí salieron estos dos señores y mandaron entrar dentro do Inca Yupanqui estaba doscientos indios con sus hachas en las manos, á los cuales mandaron que se pusiesen en torno de donde Inca Yupanqui estuviese, y que le mirasen y guardasen, no le fuese hecha alguna traicion.
info.suspiciousTextContent: And so his two best friends, begging [him praying sore], falling by any one in the room with her ​​father because he was not killed in some betrayal, and the same accusation at Apu Mayte, who was with him, look after his master, and so they went out and ordered these two people fall in Inca Yupanqui was two hundred Indians with their axes in their hands, which sent that it was made ​​around the Inca Yupanqui where he was and mirasen, and keep not, was made ​​some treason
